상실한.meaning: lost; forfeited (from 상실하다, past attributive form)

채,.meaning: as it is; with (indicating a state or condition)

손에.meaning: in the hand; on the hand

흥건하게.meaning: soaking wet; profusely (from 흥건하다, adverbial form)

배어났다..meaning: seeped out; oozed out (from 배어나다, past tense)

가야.meaning: must go; have to go (from 가다, 'must' form)

할까?.meaning: shall I do?; should I do? (from 하다, interrogative form)

돌아가야.meaning: must return; have to go back (from 돌아가다, 'must' form)

하는데....meaning: but I have to do...; but I am doing... (from 하다, descriptive/background clause ending)

일단.meaning: first of all; for now; for the time being

속에서.meaning: in the midst of, inside of

찾아보려.meaning: in order to try to find, intending to look for

다급했지만.meaning: although it was urgent, was pressed for time, but

봐도.meaning: even if one looks, no matter how much one looks

잃었니?.meaning: did you get lost?, did you lose? (informal interrogative)

가려고.meaning: intending to go, about to go

들려왔다..meaning: was heard, came to one's ears (past tense)

돌아보니,.meaning: when I turned around and looked, looking back

가득했지만.meaning: although it was full (of), filled with (but)

나머지.meaning: the rest, the remainder (often indicating 'as a result')

미처.meaning: not yet, not quite (with negative verb)

잃었구나?.meaning: you've gotten lost!, you lost it! (exclamation of realization)

끊기겠다?.meaning: seems like it will be cut off (implies worry)

손길은.meaning: hand, touch (as in a person's touch, with topic particle)

해.meaning: Do (it)!, Come on! (informal imperative of 하다)

시간엔.meaning: at this time (contracted form of 시간에는)

헤매면.meaning: if you wander, if you get lost

돼.meaning: It's fine, it can be (informal of 되다)

묻어.meaning: is embedded, is steeped (form of 묻다)

말만은.meaning: only words, as for words only (with restrictive and topic particle)

줄지어.meaning: in a line, queuing (adverbial form of 줄지다)

올라가고.meaning: going up, ascending and (connective form of 올라가다)

가는지.meaning: whether it goes, where it leads (interrogative ending)

없었지만.meaning: but there wasn't, although there wasn't

말에는.meaning: in words (with locative and topic particle)

거역할.meaning: to defy, to disobey (future/potential adnominal form of 거역하다)

망설일.meaning: to hesitate (future/potential adnominal form of 망설이다)

없다는.meaning: that there is no, that it doesn't exist (adnominal form of 없다)

가리킨.meaning: pointed to (past adnominal form of 가리키다)

확인하고.meaning: checking and, after confirming (connective form of 확인하다)

나서야.meaning: only after (connective ending 'after doing X, then Y happens')

돌아볼.meaning: to look back (future/potential adnominal form of 돌아보다)

틈도.meaning: even a moment, even a chance (with 'even' particle)

올렸다.meaning: got on, placed (past tense of 올리다)

솟아오르는.meaning: rising, surging (present adnominal form of 솟아오르다)

멀어지는.meaning: getting further away (present adnominal form of 멀어지다)

향하는지는.meaning: whether it is heading (interrogative ending + topic particle)

말만이.meaning: only words (with restrictive and subject particle)

귓가에.meaning: in one's ears, at the ear's edge

내디딘.meaning: taken a step (past adnominal form of 내딛다)

같았지만.meaning: it seemed like, but (past tense connective of 같다)

걱정하지.meaning: don't worry (part of a phrase) / to worry (stem)

건데요.meaning: it is that... (providing background or explanation)

그럼.meaning: well then / in that case / so

내게.meaning: to me / for me (contraction of 나에게)

내려서.meaning: getting off and / because got off

넘어선.meaning: that has crossed over / that has exceeded (adnominal)

눈초리가.meaning: the glare / the look in one's eyes (subject)

단어에.meaning: in the word / on the word

답변에.meaning: in the answer / to the reply

당산.meaning: Dangsan (a place name, subway station in Seoul)

데이트라는.meaning: that is called a date / a date, which is

띠었지만.meaning: although it took on / it assumed, but

라고.meaning: quoting particle, 'that...' (used for direct or indirect quotes)

라는.meaning: quoting particle, 'which is called...' (modifies a noun)

많아서.meaning: because there are many, because it is much

많지만.meaning: although there are many, although it is much

말라는.meaning: the one that says not to do (used to modify a noun)

말할.meaning: to say, to speak (future/potential form modifying a noun)

멘트를.meaning: a comment, a remark (with object marker)

목적지인.meaning: which is the destination, being the destination

묻자.meaning: as soon as one asks, when asked

밀려오는.meaning: coming in, surging, rushing in (modifying form)

반가웠어요.meaning: it was a pleasure (to meet you/him/her) (polite past tense)

반하셨어요.meaning: fell in love (honorific polite past tense)

불안감을.meaning: feeling of anxiety, unease (with object marker)

사당.meaning: Sadang (a place name or a shrine)

사실을.meaning: the fact, the truth (with object marker)

선아가.meaning: Seona (a proper name with subject marker)

선아는.meaning: Seona (a proper name with topic marker)

설마….meaning: no way..., surely not..., don't tell me...

손바닥에는.meaning: in/on the palm of the hand (with topic marker)

송골송골.meaning: in drops, in beads (often for sweat or dew)

스쳐.meaning: brushed past, grazed (infinitive/linking form of 'to brush past')

쏟아냈다.meaning: poured out, spouted (past tense of 'to pour out')

않았다.meaning: did not (past tense of auxiliary verb 'to not do')

어떡해요….meaning: What should I do? / What to do?

어울리던데요.meaning: It suited/matched well (exclamatory past form of 'to suit')

언니.meaning: older sister (used by a female), older female friend

얼어붙고.meaning: freezing, frozen and (linking form of 'to freeze')

얽히는.meaning: getting entangled, entwined (modifying form of 'to get entangled')

없어요.meaning: there isn't, don't have (polite form of 'to not exist')

없으세요.meaning: Don't you have? / Isn't there? (honorific polite interrogative of 'to not exist')

엉뚱한.meaning: absurd, whimsical, quirky (modifying form of an adjective)

여기가….meaning: Here is... (incomplete phrase, with subject marker)

역에서.meaning: at the station, from the station (with locative/source particle)

역은….meaning: The station is... (incomplete phrase, with topic marker)

영등포구청.meaning: Yeongdeungpo District Office (a specific location in Seoul)

예리해졌다.meaning: became sharp/acute (past tense of 'to become sharp')

오신.meaning: who came (past modifying form of 'to come')

올까.meaning: Shall I come/go? / Will it come/go? (speculative/interrogative form of 'to come/go')

울렸다.meaning: rang, made cry (past tense of 'to ring' or 'to make cry')

웃었지만.meaning: although laughed/smiled (past tense of 'to laugh/smile' + conjunctive)

위에.meaning: on top of, above (with locative particle)

유명해질까.meaning: Will it become famous? (speculative/interrogative form of 'to become famous')

으로.meaning: to, toward, by means of, as (directional/instrumental particle)

음.meaning: Hmm, Yes (sound of thinking or affirmation)

이수.meaning: Isu (proper noun, e.g., a person's name or place name)

이해할.meaning: to understand, understandable (future/modifying form of 'to understand')

인스타에서.meaning: on Instagram, from Instagram (with locative/source particle)

있습니다.meaning: there is, exists, have (formal polite form of 'to exist')

잊히지.meaning: not forgotten, unforgotten (negative passive form of 'to forget')

자신들의.meaning: their own, of themselves (with possessive particle)

적이.meaning: enemy (with subject particle); or: experience/time (in certain idioms)

점에.meaning: at the point, aspect, or dot

점이요.meaning: point, aspect (with subject particle and politeness suffix)

주다가요.meaning: while giving (and then...); giving (polite, indicative of continuation)

중인데….meaning: in the middle of (doing something), while (with ellipsis)

지.meaning: time (duration) (e.g., ~한 지 오래됐다: it's been a long time since...)

지났다고요.meaning: (they said) it passed/it's over (past tense, quoted, polite)

직감했죠.meaning: intuited, had a hunch (past tense, emphatic)

질문에는.meaning: to the question (with locative and topic particles)

찾아오는데.meaning: comes to find; when (it) comes (to find)

초엔.meaning: in the beginning, at the early stage

코끝을.meaning: tip of the nose (with object particle)

팔짱을.meaning: crossed arms (with object particle, as in 팔짱을 끼다)

한강.meaning: Han River (a river in South Korea)

한다니….meaning: (I heard/can't believe) that (they/you) do (it) (exclamatory, with ellipsis)

한층.meaning: one layer; a step further, even more

혹시라도.meaning: by any chance, just in case, possibly

홍대입구역.meaning: Hongik University Station (a subway station in Seoul)

흘리면서도.meaning: even while shedding/spilling/dropping (tears, sweat, blood, etc.); despite shedding/spilling/dropping (something)

되자.meaning: as soon as it became / when it became

다가가자.meaning: as soon as it approached, when it approached
